alert.note: Alert for Sutton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 05 at 1:26AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN SUTTON COUNTY THROUGH 215 AM CDT... At 125 AM CDT, Doppler radar was 14 miles south of Sonora, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... The Intersection Of Us-277 And Ranch Road 189 and Us- 277 Near The Sutton-Edwards County Line. This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 413 and 427. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
